question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Error information leak] Do error messages in lines 137 and 152 (format!('There was an error querying your node's API: {:#}', err)) leak sensitive internal implementation details that could aid reconnaissance attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Asymmetric error handling] Why does baseline provider failure return CheckerError (line 160) while target provider failures return CheckResult (lines 134-139, 149-154), and can this inconsistency be exploited to hide baseline manipulation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Missing error context] Do error paths preserve enough context about which provider failed and why, or can error confusion allow attackers to misattribute failures and avoid detection? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Resource exhaustion] Can an attacker cause the tokio::time::sleep() call (line 143) to be extended indefinitely by manipulating check_delay() values, exhausting async runtime resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Blocking operations] If provider.provide() calls (lines 131, 146, 160) block for extended periods, can they cause cascading failures in the node checker's async executor? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Memory exhaustion] Can repeated invocations with maliciously large ledger_version values (near u64::MAX) cause excessive memory allocation in string formatting operations (lines 52-101)? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: build_state_sync_version_check_result()] [String allocation DoS] Can extremely large version numbers cause format! macros (lines 52-101) to allocate unbounded string buffers, enabling memory exhaustion attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Stale baseline] If baseline_api_index_provider returns a cached/stale ledger_version (line 160), can it cause all target nodes to appear lagging when they're actually synchronized? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Version rollback] Can a baseline node that experiences a rollback (ledger_version decreasing) cause all target nodes to be incorrectly marked as healthy due to negative deltas in line 69-70? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Inconsistent snapshots] Are the three version readings (previous_target, latest_target, latest_baseline) guaranteed to be from consistent blockchain states, or can epoch boundaries cause incomparable versions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: build_state_sync_version_check_result()] [Cross-epoch comparison] When comparing versions across epoch boundaries, can epoch change events cause version numbers to reset or jump, invalidating the comparison logic in lines 46-70? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Async cancellation] If the check() function is cancelled mid-execution (between lines 131-170), can it leave providers in inconsistent states or leak resources? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Future ordering] Are the await points (lines 131, 143, 146, 160) guaranteed to execute in order, or can async runtime reordering cause version readings to be compared incorrectly? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Panic safety] If provider.provide() panics (lines 131, 146, 160), does it properly unwind or can it poison shared state in the ProviderCollection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: build_state_sync_version_check_result()] [Invalid delay_secs] If delay_secs parameter (line 43) is 0 or u64::MAX, can it cause division by zero or misleading progress rate calculations in result messages? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: new()] [Missing validation] Does new() constructor (lines 34-36) validate that version_delta_tolerance is within reasonable bounds, or can extreme values cause integer overflow in comparisons? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Struct: StateSyncVersionCheckerConfig] [Config validation] Are there any constraints on version_delta_tolerance to prevent it from being 0, potentially causing all nodes to fail lag checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Response integrity] Are the ledger_version values returned by providers (lines 132, 147, 161) cryptographically verified, or can a man-in-the-middle attacker inject false version numbers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/state_sync_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Response replay] Can an attacker capture legitimate provider responses and replay them later to make a stalled node appear healthy by replaying increasing versions? (High)
